intro: Virectaria procumbens, commonly known as the creeping virecta, is a low-growing perennial plant native to temperate regions. It features slender,匍匐 (prostrate) stems that spread along the ground, often rooting at the nodes. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, arranged in clusters. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Virectaria procumbens is valued in horticulture for its ability to form dense ground cover and its resilience in various soil conditions.
